miic.core.stretch_mod.time_shift_apply¶

time_shift_apply(corr_data, shift)[source]¶

Apply time shift to traces.

Apply time shifts to traces e.g. to align them to a common time base. Such shifts can occur in correlation traces in case of a drifting clock. This function applies the shifts. To correct for shift estimated with time_shift_estimate you need to apply negative shifts. Shifting is done in frequency domain with 5% tapering.

Parameters:
  • corr_data (ndarray) – 2d ndarray containing the correlation functions that are to be shifted. One for each row.
  • shift (ndarray) – ndarray with shift.shape[0] = corr_data.shape[0] containing the shifts in units of the sampling interval by which the trace are to be shifted
Return type:

ndarray
Returns:

shifted_mat: shifted version of the input matrix
